name: 3-fluoro-4-methoxybenzenesulfonamide
Reason: 3-fluoro-4-methoxybenzenesulfonamide is a complex molecule with multiple functional groups that can impact its melting point. The basic unit of analysis is the benzene ring, which has a melting point of around 5.5 degrees Celsius. The fluorine atom (F) increases the molecular weight and electronegativity, which can lead to a higher melting point. The methoxy group (O-CH3) adds approximately +20 degrees Celsius due to increased molecular weight and hydrogen bonding capabilities. The sulfonamide group (S(=O)(=O)N) is a polar functional group that can form hydrogen bonds, which can increase the melting point. The sulfur atom also adds rigidity to the molecule, which can contribute to the higher melting point.
